STOREFRONTS.ACCESS_TOKEN_TOOLTIP: Determines how long (in minutes) a user can stay logged in before they will need to re-enter their credentials and log back in. Minimum value is 10, Maximum value is 600.
STOREFRONTS.ANON_BUYER_TOOLTIP: The buyer organization that contains the user that should be used as the default context user for anonymous shopping. All pricing, permissions, and visibility will be based on this user
STOREFRONTS.ANON_USERNAME_TOOLTIP: The buyer user that will be used as the default context user for anonymous shopping. All pricing, permissions, and visibility will be based on this user
STOREFRONTS.REFRESH_TOKEN_TOOLTIP: Determines how long (in minutes) a refresh token can be used to keep a user logged in. Minimum value is 0, Maximum value is 43,200.
STOREFRONTS.SUMMARY: A storefront represents a hosted buyer application. Simply creating a storefront in this admin interface will not create a buyer application - that process still needs to be performed manually by a developer but once that is done certain pieces about the storefront can be managed here
